titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Eugene T. Rossides papers, 1969-1973
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-01-14T16:20-0800

change.item: Declassified materials returned to collection (box 5) by Sarah Patton.
Revised to update encoding by Samira Bozorgi.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Eugene T. Rossides Papers)//EN" "rossides.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence and memoranda relating to law enforcement aspects of Treasury Department activities, including investigation of dumping of foreign goods, violations of customs laws, and the international narcotics traffic.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Eugene T. Rossides papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1986.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Assistant Secretary of the U.S. Treasury, 1969-1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda relating to law enforcement aspects of Treasury Department activities, including investigation of dumping of foreign goods, violations of customs laws, and the international narcotics traffic.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Dept. of the Treasury.
controlaccess.subject: Customs administration--United States.
Dumping (Commercial policy)
Justice, Administration of--United States.
Narcotics, Control of.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes the following declassified records returned to file after January 2016 release by Hoover:
Memorandum for Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally, from Eugene T. Rossides, subject: "Recommended Letter to Secretary Rogers re Poppy Growing in Turkey," 8 April 1971.

Memorandum for Secretary Connally, from John R. Petty and Eugene T. Rossides, attaching a proposed letter for Connally to send to Secretary of State William P. Rogers regarding the State Department's instructions to Ambassador Handley in Turkey.
Memorandum for Secretary Connally, from Eugene T. Rossides, subject: "Turkish Opium Problem," 21 April 1971.

Memorandum for Secretary Connally, from Eugene T. Rossides, subject: "Letters to Secretaries Rogers and Laird Regarding Recommendations for Improving Vietnamese Collections of Customs Revenue and Control of Narcotics," 21 May 1971.
Letter from Secretary Connally to Secretary of State Rogers enclosing proposed changes to a cable of instructions to Ambassador Handley re Turkish opium negotation, 17 June 1971.
